answers.answer: I've been dealing with it for about 12 weeks now.  It gets easier as you get used to what your body can handle.  I've been able to control it with diet alone and no insulin.  For me it's mostly about portion control and getting more fruits and veggies and less sweets.  Pairing a protein or veggie with your carb usually helps to balance your numbers.  Good luck!
How far along are you?  Not 100% sure yet if I have it going in for 3 hr test this week but I'm always dizzy or light headed with bad headaches and sweets do make it worst
Is it something that goes away after pregnancy? Or something you just live with

I'm 40+4 weeks.  I'm being induced on Sunday.  They say about 90% of women won't have any issues with it after the baby is born.  My doctor said since I've been able to control it with my diet then it should go away after I deliver.  But there is a greater risk to develop diabetes later in life, so I'll just have to be careful with watching what I eat.  Good luck with your test.   It's long and boring so make sure you bring something to keep you busy.

question: Hey ladies any1 have gestational diabetes if so how do you control it?  What are your thoughts on the issue.
title: gestational diabetes
